selected_quotes: The effects of different exercise modes for preventing endothelial dysfunction of arteries and bone loss in rats.

citation.abstract: Several epidemiological studies have demonstrated that there are positive correlations between vascular disorders and bone loss in postmenopausal women. The aim of the present study was to examine the effect of different types of exercise (e.g., climbing and swimming) for preventing endothelial dysfunction of arteries and bone loss in ovariectomized rats.
citation.title: The effects of different exercise modes for preventing endothelial dysfunction of arteries and bone loss in ovariectomized rats.

author.name: Craig Sale
author.description: Professor of Human Physiology, @MSPResearchGrp Research Group, Director of the SHAPE Research Centre. Views are my own and not those of NTU!
